result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cathleen C Boland

records.addlTxt: Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

8:31 AM Defendant Cathleen C Boland in court.  Attorney Anna M Kees appeared by Zoom for Cathleen C Boland.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. The Court addresses the WCS non-compliance. Attorney Kees was not aware that the WCS non-compliance was going to be addressed today and would ask for the defendant to be admonished. The State has no objection with the Court admonishing the defendant. The Court admonishes the defendant and would ask for the defendant to go to WCS to check in immediately after Court today and would ask for WCS to inform the Court whether the defendant appeared at WCS or not. The date before the Trial Court shall remain as previously set.

Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 9/12/2022 received and filed.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/12/2022 - The Court requires that bond be addressed in this case at the time of the initial appearance hearing on 9/13 in the defendant's new case, 22CM1577.**

Returned Notice of Hearing as Addressed to Cathleen C Boland for Hearing on 11-11-2022 at 10:00am 
Return to Sender. Moved Left No Address. Unable to Forward. Return to Sender

Hearing on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Anna Kees

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to have contact with Victim A only as approved by the Family Court order 17FA165. Defendant may not discuss the criminal cases in any way with either Victim A or Victim B. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.   CAM duration and/or drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM and/or drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody.

09:09 AM Defendant Cathleen C Boland in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for Initial Appearance.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Court sets signature bond with conditions. 
Cash on hand to be refunded to the poster.
Given her compliance with CAM in the 22CM324 case, the Court does not expect WCS to re-implement the CAM, unless deemed necessary.
  Hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial appearance on May 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
